Description: Fragment of wall of a North Ionian pottery deep bowl. Slipped on the exterior with the remains of a floral, a leftward maeander frieze above (? orientation uncertain). The interior black with two red bands lined in white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See British Museum 1886,0401.1090 for a similar floral beside the handle.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 31, no. 116 pl. 30)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.149)
